message: Nikon D3X - just see what it would be like to work with a high-end body.
And if I really had an unlimited budget, I'd probably just try every lens :)
But I'd start with a 70-200mm f/2.8, a 14-24mm f/2.8, and 2 primes: 35mm f/1.4 and 50mm f/.4
And after a quick google search that adds up to just under $13k  :)
I would take Leica S2, Summarit-S 35mm f/2.5 ASPH, andSummarit-S 70mm f/2.5 ASPH
@kukkurovaca An 8x10 outfit would be nice as well
I completely agree  with bkmontgomery:  70-200mm f/2.8, a 14-24mm f/2.8, and 2 primes: 35mm f/1.4 and 50mm f/.4...

I would probably go with a pair of Leica m9's  a 21 Sumilux, 35 Sumilux, 50 Noctilux, 90 Summicron, and a 135 telyt.  Then to round things out I would need a full frame DSLR, either Nikon or Canon, and a 200ish macro lens and how about a 200-400. :-)
I'm a man of (relatively) simple tastes: 5D mark II (own the mk I), 50 f1.4 (already own), 85 f1.8 and 16–35 f2.8.
@kennethreitz agreed.  i view the 85 prime as pretty much crucial.

Ive thought about this some more and changed my mine on the 16–35.  Id drop that and instead get the 24–70.  I dont think id ever really want/need a super wide, and the 24–70 would be nice for those times when i dont want to carry three lenses.
@danT I have the 24-105 f/4 L and it's AWESOME. I've heard they're going to come out 24-70 f/2.8 L w/ image stabilization later this year. It sounds very tempting. :)
medium format with a digital back.
